page.title: 12Tarset Village Hall
page.content: Situated at Lanehead, the hall serves as a community meeting place for the surrounding district. Built of wood with a corrugated iron roof, it is well maintained. A hard-working committee organise money-raising events and help in practical ways to keep it so. Recent work has included improvements to the kitchen & cloak- rooms, complete re-wiring & re-decorating inside and out. It is used regularly for Parish Council and Women's Institute meetings. Other lettings include Keep Fit and Country Dancing, whist drives, dances, coffee mornings, Leek Club show, an ADAS meeting re tourism, a Harvest Supper which raised money for cancer research and a table tennis tournament. During the summer two ladies hired the hall to make teas for the tourists.
